snippet: Hillel Nahmad, owner of Helly Nahmad Gallery, has been accused of playing a leadership role in a gambling and money-laundering network.
abstract: Hillel Nahmad, owner of Helly Nahmad Gallery, has been accused of playing a leadership role in a $100 million gambling and money-laundering network, and the case has cast a harsh public spotlight on his family art business; family's fortune is said to have been built in the art business, but information about how it actually works has been difficult to pin down.

byline.original: By JAMES GLANZ, RANDY KENNEDY and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Colin Moynihan contributed reporting from New York, and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Hillel Nahmad, owner of Helly Nahmad Gallery, has been accused of playing a leadership role in a gambling and money-laundering network.

headline.seo: Helly Nahmad Gallery Owner Indicted in Gambling Case
